main.name: Patrick Charlton
main.description: focused on building mobile and web applications with eye-catching UIs and seamless UX design
main.bio1: There are a few things I hold dear to me in this life – my health, my work, and my happiness.
main.bio2: Throughout my four years at Willamette University I played forward for the men’s soccer team, became NWC Conference Champions in 2017 and continued onto the NCAA tournament. With that in the rear-view, I am constantly sought fonewr ways to push myself. I swapped 5 AM team workouts for untouched snow on dawn patrol and the opportunity to just sit and appreciate a pretty sunrise here and there.
main.bio3: Just as I condition my body, I would be incomplete if i neglected my mind. What I love most about coding is the constant challenge. Each problem is a puzzle, complex yes, but still a puzzle nonetheless. Sometimes all it takes is seeing it from a different angle. Caffeine helps too. Although it may get frustrating at times, the more rigorous the exercise the more fulfillment gained.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to contact me below.

resume.skillmessage: Languages and Frameworks listed by proficiency

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science
education.description:
I spent most of my time running between the music studio, the soccer pitch, and the research lab. 
I created Willamette's Mobile App Development Club for students to collaborate and learn real-world skills, served as the Community Service Chair for the Delta Zeta chapter of the Sigma Chi Fraternity, and let off steam playing electric violin (yes, electric violin) for a local band, Call Falck.

work.title: Research Assistant 2
work.description: Conducted research in collaboration with clinical researchers in the Division of Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine at OHSU to improve the quality and standard of healthcare for critical care and pulmonary disease patients, and enhance patient-clinician communication.

work.title: Frontend Engineer Intern
work.description:
Helped develop a React Native mobile app on iOS and Android to provide an interactive map for happy hour deals and promotions for local bars and restaurants in the user’s area. 
Designed the client-side website’s landing page, including icons, for onboarding bars and restaurants and implemented those designs using the Bootstrap 4 framework.

work.title: Android Developer
work.description: Developed a location-based Android app with an MVVM architecture in Kotlin from design through implementation to provide a platform for artists to collaborate with each other and gain exposure through online methods.

work.title: Android Engineer Intern
work.description:
Collaborated with team members using Scrum Agile Methodology (JIRA, Daily Standup, Sprint Backlog, Retrospectives, GitLab, Code Reviews, Unit Tests) to develop convenient, polished mobile apps for Kroger and its subsidiaries. 
Owned refund and other features on post-order pages, creating a user-friendly environment for consumers to view and interact with their pending, cancelled, and completed orders.

projects.title: Happy Hour
projects.category: Landing Page design for the Happy Hour App's client-facing website

projects.title: Artist Integrated
projects.category: Location-based live events app for Android and iOS

projects.title: Jax
projects.category: Illustration created in Fresco of the beloved doggo Jax
